channel.title: Bug Alert - Bug Alert Contributors
channel.description: A nonprofit service for alerting security and IT professionals of high-impact and 0day vulnerabilities.

item.title: Authorization Vulnerability in Atlassian Confluence (CVE-2023-22518)
item.description: An authorization vulnerability exploitable by unauthenticated users has been discovered in Atlassian Confluence, and has been assigned a bug alert severity of 'very high'. Exploitation of the vulnerability can cause substanial data loss. Atlassian recommends removing installations from the Internet immediately if they cannot be patched.
item.dc:creator: Bug Alert Contributors

item.title: Privilege Escalation in Atlassian Confluence (CVE-2023-22515)
item.description: A privilege escalation flaw has been found, and is being actively exploited, in Atlassian Confluence, and has been assigned a bug alert severity of 'very high'. Atlassian recommends removing installations from the Internet immediately if they cannot be patched.
item.dc:creator: Bug Alert Contributors

item.title: Testing International Call and SMS Support via Twilio
item.description: This is a test notice, which you have opted in to. Bug Alert has completed integrating Twilio support for international calls and SMS. Save our phone number to your contacts!
item.dc:creator: Bug Alert Contributors

item.title: Multiple Vulnerabilities in Atlassian Products (CVE-2022-26136, CVE-2022-26137, CVE-2022-26138)
item.description: Multiple Vulnerabilities have been disclosed in Atlassian Products. A hardcoded credential vulnerability in Questions for Confluence, and Servlet Filter Bypass Vulnerabilities have been found in multiple Atlassian products that may enable Authentication Bypasses, XSS Attacks, and CORS attacks. These vulnerabilities have been assigned a bug alert severity of 'very high'. Atlassian recommends patching affected installations immediately.
item.dc:creator: Bug Alert Contributors

item.title: Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution in Atlassian Confluence (CVE-2022-26134)
item.description: An unauthenticated remote code execution flaw has been found, and is being actively exploited, in Atlassian Confluence, and has been assigned a bug alert severity of 'very high'. Atlassian recommends removing installations from the Internet immediately.
item.dc:creator: Bug Alert Contributors

item.title: Remote Code Execution in Microsoft Office Products for Windows
item.description: A remote code execution vulnerability, dubbed 'Follina', has been found in Microsoft Office via Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool (MSDT). This issue can be exploited in the default configuration on Windows, and only requires the user be tricked into downloading a malicious file. There is no patch. This issue has been assigned a bug alert severity of 'high'.
item.dc:creator: Bug Alert Contributors

item.title: Authentication Bypass in Atlassian Jira (CVE-2022-0540)
item.description: An authentication bypass vulnerability has been found in Atlassian Jira. This issue can be exploited in the default configuration, and has been assigned a bug alert severity of 'very high'.
item.dc:creator: Bug Alert Contributors

item.title: Confirmed remote code execution (RCE) in Spring Core, an extremely popular Java framework (CVE-2022-22965)
item.description: Praetorian has confirmed that a remote code execution vulnerability exists in Spring, an extremely popular Java framework. How broadly this impacts the Spring ecosystem remains unclear. The flaw has been assigned a bug alert severity of 'critical'.
item.dc:creator: Bug Alert Contributors

item.title: Advanced warning: possible remote code execution (RCE) in Spring, an extremely popular Java framework
item.description: An unconfirmed, but possible, remote code execution vulnerability is believed to exist in Spring, an extremely popular Java framework. This issue is likely easily exploited in common configurations. If confirmed, another notice will be sent out with a severity of 'critical'. While unconfirmed, the severity has been assigned 'high'.
item.dc:creator: Bug Alert Contributors

item.title: Unauthenticated user impersonation (auth bypass) in SAP
item.description: A request smuggling issue in SAP NetWeaver, SAP Content Server, and SAP Web Dispatcher allows unauthenticated user impersonation. These systems are commonly Internet-facing. The flaw has been assigned a bug alert severity of 'critical', and the vendor has supplied patches.
item.dc:creator: Bug Alert Contributors

item.title: Local privilege escalation in pkexec, a core Linux system component
item.description: A local privilege escalation bug (from any user to root) has been found polkit's pkexec, and exploit code is available. This binary is a SUID root program available on every major Linux distro, and is most commonly installed if a GUI is present. The flaw has been assigned a bug alert severity of 'very high'.
item.dc:creator: Bug Alert Contributors

item.title: Post-Launch Updates: Telegram Support, Community Slack, and Celebrating Success
item.description: The Bug Alert team is celebrating a successful launch with more features (Telegram support!), a community Slack, and more.
item.dc:creator: Bug Alert Contributors

item.title: Bug Alert is Live
item.description: Hello, world! Bug Alert is now live. Read the announcement post at https://mattslifebytes.com/2022/01/04/bugalert-org/ to learn more.
item.dc:creator: Bug Alert Contributors

item.title: RCE in Log4j
item.description: A remote code execution vulnerability has been found in the popular Java logging library Log4j. This issue is easily exploited in common configurations, and has been assigned a bug alert severity of 'critical'.
item.dc:creator: Bug Alert Contributors
